entries.title: US: 3 dead, 4 injured in Los Angeles shooting
entries.description: The killing occurred early Saturday morning in the Beverly Crest neighborhood. This is at least the sixth mass shooting in California this month.

entries.title: In France, donations to charities increase and take on many forms
entries.description: Between 2010 and 2021, the number of donations declared to the French tax authorities by individuals doubled. This increase is partly due to new fundraising approaches aimed at younger audiences.

entries.title: Israel: Two injured in a new shooting  after fatal attack in East Jerusalem
entries.description: Police had earlier announced the arrest of 42 people in connection with Friday's synagogue attack, one of the deadliest in Jerusalem in years.

entries.title: Retired NATO general Pavel  wins Czech presidential race
entries.description: Petr Pavel comfortably beat Andrej Babis,  a combative business tycoon who had been prime minister since 2017.

entries.title: Opium production explodes in Myanmar
entries.description: In addition to the upturn in poppy cultivation since the February 2021 coup, there has been a proliferation of synthetic drug laboratories in the country.

entries.title: Gucci appoints Sabato de Sarno as its new creative director
entries.description: Defying all predictions, a relative unknown has been chosen to succeed Alessandro Michele as head of  Gucci. The 39-year-old Italian will present his first collection at Milan Fashion Week in September.

entries.title: In India, a high-altitude hunger strike to protect an icy desert
entries.description: The Himalayan region of Ladakh is threatened by excessive tourism and economic development. An engineer has gone on a five-day hunger strike to demand the authorities to safeguard this territory.

entries.title: Jean-Luc Mélenchon, a leader weakened by his own base
entries.description: The leader of radical-left party La France Insoumise and instigator of the left-wing NUPES alliance has been criticized by his followers for his handling of the party's restructuring and his deputy's conviction for domestic abuse.

entries.title: Australian Open: Sabalenka beats Rybakina to win her first Grand Slam title
entries.description: Wimbledon champion Rybakina was overpowered in the end but played her full part in a very strong final.

entries.title: Attack near East Jerusalem synagogue kills seven, raises risk of escalation
entries.description: A Palestinian killed seven people in a settlement on the outskirts of Jerusalem on Friday night. It was the worst attack on Israelis in 15 years, and came a day after an Israeli army raid in Jenin in the West Bank killed nine people.

entries.title: The video of Tyre Nichols' fatal arrest reopens debate on police violence
entries.description: The 29-year-old African-American man was beaten by Memphis police officers after being pulled over in a traffic stop. He died three days later. Video footage of his beating was released on Friday night.

entries.title: Peru Congress rejects Boluarte's demands for early elections
entries.description: Dina Boluarte, who has refused to step down despite furious nationwide protests calling for her to resign, said on Friday that elections should be brought forward to December.

entries.title: UK regional airline Flybe ceases trading, cancels all flights
entries.description: Flybe customers booked to travel will need to make their own alternative arrangements via other airlines, rail or coach operators.

entries.title: In Benin, electric motorcycles are gaining popularity
entries.description: To speed up the transition to a greener economy, the government has eliminated all VAT and customs duties on 100% electric vehicles.

entries.title: The rise of political influence on Sweden's justice system
entries.description: The tradition of political parties appointing lay judges is facing growing criticism in light of the recent rise of far-right political movements.

entries.title: In French gardens, nearly half of the bird species observed in spring are in decline
entries.description: One of the country's most important scientific data-gathering programs involving the general public has revealed an overall decline in common bird populations.

entries.title: Extradited French cybercribe suspect pleads not guilty
entries.description: 21-year-old Raoult is being charged with nine counts, including conspiracy, computer intrusion, wire fraud and aggravated identity theft.

entries.title: From Moscow to Sciences Po, the dissident ways of Sergei Guriev
entries.description: Number two of Paris' prestigious university, the Russian economist in exile since 2013 is a member of the group responsible for drawing up international sanctions against Russia.

entries.title: Violence in the West Bank: 'The Israeli government of Netanyahu has chosen to follow a hard line'
entries.description: In an interview with 'Le Monde,' Dominique Vidal explains the recent upsurge in violence in the occupied West Bank.

entries.title: Frenchman Adam Siao Him Fa wins the European figure skating title
entries.description: At 21 years old, he's the first French national to win the championship in 12 years.

entries.title: 'Black Legends': A tribute to African-American music and its great performers
entries.description: In Paris, the Bobino Theater is celebrating the great tunes of gospel, hip-hop, jazz and soul.

entries.title: Death of Tyre Nichols: Bodycam footage of deadly beating released
entries.description: The footage shows police savagely beating the 29-year-old FedEx worker for three minutes. Cities across the US are bracing for large demonstrations.
